# Pull Request Title

## Summary

Provide a short (1-3 sentences) summary of what this change does and why it is needed.

## Related Issue

Closes: # (use issue number or full URL if applicable)

## Type of Change

- [ ] Bug fix (non-breaking change)
- [ ] New feature
- [ ] Breaking change (requires documentation/migration)
- [ ] Documentation only
- [ ] Refactor
- [ ] Tests
- [ ] CI / Build

## Key Changes

- Summarize the most important changes and why they were made.
- List the primary files or modules changed (e.g., pkg/module/file.ext).

## How to Test / Verification Steps

1. Describe steps to reproduce the current behavior (if applicable).
2. List commands, environment variables, or setup required to run tests or manual checks.
3. Describe the expected result for each verification step.

## Test Coverage

- [ ] Unit tests added/updated
- [ ] Integration tests added/updated
- [ ] End-to-end tests added/updated
- [ ] Manual QA performed (describe below)

### Manual QA Notes

- Include any manual checks performed and their outcomes.

## Impact and Migration

- Backwards compatibility: describe any breaking or incompatible changes.
- Migration steps: list DB migrations, config changes, or other manual steps required.
- Performance and security considerations (if any).

## Rollout & Rollback Plan (optional)

- Describe rollout strategy (gradual rollout, feature flags) and rollback steps.

## Release Notes / Changelog Entry (suggested)

A short line describing the change suitable for release notes.

## Checklist

- [ ] Code builds and lints locally
- [ ] All tests pass locally and in CI
- [ ] Documentation updated (README, docs site) if necessary
- [ ] Relevant reviewers/teams have been notified
- [ ] No credentials or secrets are included

## Additional Notes

- Any extra context for reviewers, links to related PRs, design docs, screenshots, or commands.
